body.name: puredown® Grey Feather Comforter Full/Queen Size, Lightweight Duvet Insert, Ultra-Soft 100% Cotton Shell for All Season Light Warmth Bedding Comforters
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 16 hrs 22 mins
features: 【100% Cotton Cover】- 100% cotton cover feels incredibly soft and smooth while staying breathable, noiseless when moving, you can feel like sleeping on the clouds. Sleep soundly all year long with this medium warmth duvet insert.

【Premium Filling】 - This grey feather down comforter is filled with sufficient feather and down blend filling (95/5), which is ethically sourced and RDS, OEKO-Tex Standard 100 certified. It keeps you warm without adding extra weight and bulk and exceeds your sleep expectations providing you with year-round enjoyment.

【Lightweight Comforter】 - Warm weather sleepers and those who prefer to sleep cool can still enjoy our lightweight comforter. Combines softness, comfort, and breathability, this comforter prevents overheating, keeps you cool, dry, and warm, helps you wake refreshed. Twin Size: 68*88”, 40.8 oz fill weight; - Full/Queen Size: 88*88”, 52.9 oz fill weight; - King Size: 104*88”, 62.5 oz fill weight;- Oversized Queen Size: 98*98”, 65.6 oz fill weight.

【Exquisite Details】- Box-stitched design keeps the filling in place for maximum warmth, without any clumping. Corner tabs help secure the comforter in place, prevent shifting, superior double-needle stitch avoids leakage, makes the comforter more durable, ensures a stable and comfortable sleep.

【Care Instruction】- Machine wash in gentle cycle with cold water, tumble dry with a low temperature. It is usually unnecessary to clean a down comforter frequently, so as not to make the down filling less effective. Professionally clean your comforter only every few years. -The down comforter is packaged in a vacuum bag, it is recommended to spread it for a few hours and pat the comforter gently to fully expand or tumble in the dryer for 10 minutes at low temperature at first-time use.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The most fabulous down comforter!
reviews.reviewText: This down comforter is a dream. It’s packaged well and once out of the boxes and laid out it puffs out very nicely. It’s like a cloud hugging you. It’s warm and so comfortable. It’s nearly impossible to climb out of in the morning simply because it’s so perfectly wonderful. The price was fantastic and I couldn’t ask for more.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Well made no feather fallout, comfortable
reviews.reviewText: The comforter is made with high quality ticking and fully stuffed with down. We have been using this for over a month now and I have not seen one feather escape from the comforter. It is very comfortable in our NorthWest weather which tends to be very damp and in the 40's for most of the winter months. I keep a duvet cover on it all the time so it doesn't get dirty. The only thing I would say is if you don't like any weight on you when you sleep this comforter may not be for you. It does have a medium weight to it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Cozy and comfortable
reviews.reviewText: I was going to return it becaise my kids bought me one. After feeling it and seeing the quality I amSo happy I did. It’s well made and a great quilt!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very soft and lightweight
reviews.reviewText: I bought this product to use during the warm summer weather. So far I have been very satisfied with the comfort level, and the weight of the comforter. I would recommend it to anyone who needs a lighter duvet during the summer.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2019
reviews.reviewText: Bought this comforter a little over a year ago to go inside a duvet cover. It's so warm and cozy! I absolutely love it! I sleep cold, and this keeps me nice and warm, eliminating the need for extra blankets. The weight is great, too! You feel tucked in but not weighed down. Love it so much I bought the same one for my daughter (just a different size) when she wanted a new comforter.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Super Fluffy, but currently running a bit hot
reviews.reviewText: So far this comforter has fluffed up nicely and is quite cozy, but I've found it to be quite hot to sleep with. I tend to be someone who heats up considerably while sleeping and like the room to be chilly bordering on cold, and I still find that I have overheated at night. Two caveats to this: 1) in addition to the comforter I am using a heather cotton set of sheets, which seems like it may be a partial cause of the problem and 2) I have a duvet cover over the duvet (which by the way is very easy to put on) which could also be causing the overheating

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2020
reviews.reviewText: This is so soft and light weight but really warm and we love it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Super durable & fluffy!
reviews.reviewText: One of my favorite purchases from Amazon in the last 6 months. This comforter withstands two crazy dogs & is super comfortable.

reviews.reviewTitle: Well worth the money and extremely comfortable
reviews.reviewText: Over the last number of weeks, I've really come to like this duvet.The duvet arrived well packaged, not just in a plastic bag like I've seen others, the ridged packaging also keeps it clean while in transport. This is important since if packed too tightly there is a tendency for the down to clump up. That said, even here there was a little clumping but a few good shakes loosened everything right up.We took a good look at how it was made and are pretty happy. The stitching is all well done, we didn't find a single leftover thread sticking out anyplace. The pattern is all exactly the same and corners are well put together. All panels are fitted so that everything lines up.► Both my wife and I find the material to be very soft and comfortable when it lays up against the face.► When moved it makes virtually no rustling or any other sound, other than maybe when it comes up against day old bristles on my face.► It is nice and light. We both down like heavy blankets, especially those weighted ones, and prefer to stay warm without it feeling like a truck parked on top of us.► We started using it before it really cooled off around here and at night it never really got below 20C in the house. It was too warm but now after the outside temperatures have dropped significantly it's very comfortable, we now keep the house at 18C.► While the information here lists it as an all-season item it really is too warm for summer and the edge seasons, at least for us.After washing the cover we always give the duvet a good shake to make sure the down and feathers stay fluffy as there are times when a portion gets squished as we roll over in the night.Size-wise, this is a perfect fit (king) and it fits nicely into a cover we've had for some time. We prefer to use covers so that dust, pet hair, and general house dust doesn't get stuck to it.For the price, this is a great buy. I know there are more expensive options out there and I've slept under some of them but I can't think of any reason why I would spend more money. None of the more expensive options have been any softer or more comfortable so why bother?

reviews.reviewTitle: Not as airy or fluffy as my other duvet but it doesn't cause me to overheat
reviews.reviewText: In comparison to my old feather down duvet, this one seems less fluffy and more dense which isn’t necessarily a bad thing. Even though the weather is a bit too warm to switch to a duvet cover right now I’ve been sleeping with this duvet and I have to say, I really like the heaviness of it – it feels remarkably similar to a weighted blanket which is very soothing to me. It kept me warm but not too warm – I didn’t wake up sweaty. The overall quality seems really nice with strong stitching around the perimeter.This duvet is filled with 60% white goose down and the remaining 40% is white goose feathers. It’s the company’s All Season duvet so it might be comfortable for use all year round, both in frigidly cold winters and stinkin hot summers! I can’t say how well it will keep me warm in the winter yet but for end of summer season use, it’s ideal for me.One of my cats just barfed on it today so I will have to put it through the wash. I’ll let you guys know how it fares!

Wow I’m loving how soft and fluffy this duvet is.This duvet fits perfectly into my duvet covers with no issues and I’m very impressed with how well it’s stitched with the fluffy spots being spread out evenly. I’ve been sleeping with this duvet for the past week and I’ve been loving it, it’s weird because it almost feels heavy like a weighted blanket but at the same time it’s lightweight and fluffy like a cloud. It can get a little warm in the summer but it’ll be perfect for the winter months.Overall I’m loving this duvet insert and I’ll be using it for every season, I’m hoping it stays fluffy.

Very nice - the 500 thread count cotton advertised is soft and smooth, the outer seams are double stitched with piping for added durability. The fabric is really nice here, and the stitching is top notch, there is no stray down anywhere and the baffles are well sewn. The comforter "puffs" up considerably when you take it out of the zip up bag, but is very light. Fit our king sized bed perfectly - nothing quite like a down comforter for warmth.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's okay, but it's certainly not for all seasons - at least not for us.
reviews.reviewText: This duvet is described as for all seasons, but it's too warm for summer use. It's not that we just aren't used to down duvets during the summer, in fact, I swapped out our usual goose down duvet purchased from a major department store (with a much higher MSRP) with this one last night to be able to directly compare them. This duvet gets hot and stuffy where our old one does not nearly as much, somehow. I suppose this would be a plus in the winter but I'm switching back to our old one until at least then.Actual construction of the duvet is not bad but not top of the line either. The stitching throughout all looks good, not sloppy and not weak but the fabric is rather "stiff", it doesn't flow as nicely as our old duvet does - though I'm struggling here to come up with a clear way to describe what I mean. The baffles that keep the down evenly distributed in the blanket are there, but they are pretty sparsely distributed so even right away when I held it up to the light you could see that there was some bunching inside. It's not something that is super obvious when in use, though, but more baffles would have been better. Still, at the price point, I think quality is fine - you have to remember this isn't a $400-500 duvet.It does not smell like chemicals - at all. It doesn't come vacuum packed, so it's not compressed - it's just folded in a reusable zippered bag. At the end of the day I think the quality and comfort are fine for what it costs, but just don't expect a luxury experience.
